Key Match Events: England won by 8 wickets with 15 balls remaining.
West Indies scored 180/4 in their innings.
England chased down the target of 181 in 17.3 overs, scoring 181/2.
Pre-Game Insights: High-octane duel anticipated as two-time champions go head-to-head in Super Eight.
West Indies come into this contest on an eight-match unbeaten run.
England and West Indies are each competing for an unprecedented third T20 World Cup title.
West Indies have showcased a batting line-up with complete faith in each other's attributes.
England's disjointed build-up is a partial excuse for their previous performances.
Phil Salt's unrelenting approach at the top of England's order has never been more valuable.
Gudakesh Motie's left-arm offerings have the ability to apply a handbrake to free-flowing teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be another outing for the belter of a surface on which West Indies racked up 218 for 5 against Afghanistan.
The dimensions are a touch lop-sided, 63 metres on one square boundary, compared to 72 metres on the other.
England and West Indies duked it out in an entertaining T20I series in December, with West Indies winning 3-2.
Moeen Ali and Obey McCoy each need one wicket to reach 50 in T20Is, while Akeal Hosein needs two more for the same milestone.
England have played three previous T20Is in St Lucia, and have never yet lost a game.
West Indies have played in ten of the 21 T20Is at the venue, winning six of those, including five of their last six.
Others: West Indies captain Rovman Powell wants his team to make use of having already played on Wednesday's strip.
Reece Topley predicts strong St Lucian support after England's fans outnumbered the locals in December's T20I series.
